title: Why is inflation in the US so high?
description: A surge in government spending drove US inflation to the highest of advanced economies last year.

title: Writing a book in a day to get more kids reading
description: South African charity Book Dash is creating children's books in super-fast time.

title: Vaping - is it a risk-free option?
description: Colourful gadgets and fruity flavours are popular, but what's really known about their health effects?

title: Ros Atkins on… The Rwanda asylum seekers plan
description: Ros Atkins looks at the government’s controversial plan to fly some illegal arrivals to Rwanda.

title: Ukraine war: Every bridge leading to key city Severodonetsk destroyed
description: Severodonetsk is now effectively cut off from the rest of the country, the local governor says.

title: Lysychansk: Russia erasing history in Ukraine's 'dead city'
description: The fabric of Lysychansk is being destroyed by intense Russian bombardment, writes Orla Guerin.

title: BBC unveils modernised flagship TV news studio
description: The upgraded set is revealed to viewers during Monday's BBC News at Ten.

title: Ukraine war round-up: City cut off and a story of escape
description: All bridges to a key city are destroyed and one woman tells of her escape to England.

title: Ramsay Hunt syndrome: 'It's taken away my independence'
description: Justin Bieber recently revealed he's been diagnosed with the condition, which is linked to shingles.

title: Google engineer says Lamda AI system may have its own feelings
description: One of the firm's software engineers believes chats with an AI system suggest it has feelings.

title: Ukraine war: Russia earns $97bn on energy exports since invasion
description: A report warns of potential loopholes in efforts to limit use of Russian oil and gas.

title: Operose Health: What I saw working undercover at a GP surgery
description: BBC Panorama reporter Jacqui Wakefield worked as a receptionist at an Operose Health GP practice.

title: Archie Battersbee treatment should stop, judge rules
description: Doctors argued Archie Battersbee,12, is brain-stem dead and life-support treatment should end.

title: Starmer investigated by standards watchdog over late gift registrations
description: The Labour leader appears to have missed the deadline in declaring two Arsenal tickets and an oil painting.

title: Arron Banks loses Russia libel case against Carole Cadwalladr
description: The Brexit campaigner says he will "likely" appeal against the High Court judgement.

title: Pope Francis tells missionaries to talk to abuse survivors
description: Mark Murray suffered repeated sexual abuse as a child while at a Catholic priest training school.

title: Ballymurphy victims' families to receive significant damages
description: A priest and a mother of eight were among 10 people killed in Belfast after an Army operation in 1971.

title: Rwanda asylum plan: Number of people on first flight close to single figures
description: Campaigners are trying to stop the first deportation on Tuesday, with 11 people due to fly currently.

title: Lewis Hamilton to race at Canadian Grand Prix and 'wouldn't miss it for the world' despite pain
description: Lewis Hamilton says he plans to compete at the Canadian Grand Prix and "wouldn't miss it for the world" despite experiencing pain in Sunday's race in Baku.

title: England v New Zealand: Joe Root hits six with ‘incredible’ reverse scoop
description: England batter Joe Roots hits an "incredible" reverse-scoop for six with only his second ball of the day on day four of the second Test against New Zealand at Trent Bridge.

title: Brexit: PM to unveil plans to scrap parts of NI Protocol agreed with EU
description: The UK wants to rewrite part of the Northern Ireland Protocol but the EU says this breaks international law.

title: Erling Haaland: Manchester City complete signing of Norwegian striker from Borussia Dortmund
description: Erling Haaland completes his £51.2m transfer to Premier League champions Manchester City from Borussia Dortmund.

title: Fears for UK economy grow as higher prices bite
description: The economy contracted by 0.3% in April after it shrank by 0.1% in March, official figures show.

title: Ghostbusters fan wish comes true on Leeds library ghoul hunt
description: George, eight, spent the day chasing ghosts around Leeds Central Library.

title: Manchester bombing survivor climbs to Mount Kilimanjaro summit
description: Martin Hibbert was paralysed from the waist down during a bomb attack at Manchester Arena in 2017.

title: Xbox: New Starfield, Minecraft and Forza gameplay unveiled
description: Microsoft shows off more than 30 forthcoming gaming experiences in its summer showcase.

title: Food strategy criticised by government's own adviser
description: England's future food strategy is being released amid criticism from campaigners it lacks ambition.

title: Rebel Wilson: Australian paper offers apology but denies outing actress
description: Australian reporter apologises after he was accused of trying to "out" the actor last week.

title: The Papers: PM warned over NI plans and death of Ukraine hero
description: The government's bill to change the Northern Ireland Protocol is the focus for many of Monday's papers.

title: GP chain replacing doctors with less qualified staff
description: BBC Panorama went undercover at a surgery run by the UK's biggest provider of GP services to the NHS.

title: US gun control: Cautious welcome to bipartisan deal on new safety measures
description: Shootings survivors say the planned reforms - although limited - are a step in the right direction.

title: Chris Mason: Does PM have support for NI Protocol bill?
description: The bid to change post-Brexit trade procedures is set to prompt a row, writes our political editor.

title: Queen Elizabeth II becomes second-longest serving monarch
description: In two years, she would overtake Louis XIV of France who reigned for more than 72 years.
